bug.description:
PyTorch currently doesn't have sparse dropout <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/35798>pytorch/pytorch#35798</denchmark-link>
I see that it's being emulated here
RecBole/recbole/model/general_recommender/gcmc.py
Line 437 in cedd7ea
class SparseDropout(nn.Module):
and
RecBole/recbole/model/general_recommender/ngcf.py
Line 35 in cedd7ea
def sparse_dropout(x, rate, noise_shape):
Regular PyTorch Dropout is disabled when model.eval is called because training is set to false on the model
RecBole/recbole/trainer/trainer.py
Line 362 in 511cda8
self.model.eval()
Are these emulations of sparse dropout being disabled somewhere during evaluation?

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deklanw>@deklanw</denchmark-link> . Thanks for your reminder, that's exactly a bug and we have fixed it in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/RUCAIBox/RecBole/pull/601>#601</denchmark-link> .
